qas.question: When was the oldest Paris theater founded?
What is the name of Paris' oldest theater?
Who runs Paris' oldest theater today?
What famous museum is Comedie-Francaise located next to?

context: Theatre traditionally has occupied a large place in Parisian culture, and many of its most popular actors today are also stars of French television. The oldest and most famous Paris theatre is the <a1_0>Comédie-Française<a1_0/>, founded in <a0_0>1680<a0_0/>. Run by the <a2_0>French government<a2_0/>, it performs mostly French classics at the Salle Richelieu in the Palais-Royal at 2 rue de Richelieu, next to <a3_0>the Louvre<a3_0/>.  of Other famous theaters include the Odéon-Théâtre de l'Europe, next to the Luxembourg Gardens, also a state institution and theatrical landmark; the Théâtre Mogador, and the Théâtre de la Gaîté-Montparnasse.
